item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Thursday, January 9, 2025 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Announcing Rust 1.84.0 (41 points | 7 comments)
2. Not every user owns an iPhone (26 points | 27 comments)
3. Northeastern’s redesign of the Khoury curriculum abandons the fundamentals of computer science (14 points | 26 comments)
4. 16GB Raspberry Pi 5 available now (25 points | 22 comments)
5. A Pixel Parable (13 points | 4 comments)
6. Alloy 6.2.0 released (6 points | no comments)
7. UK Users: Lobsters needs your help with the Online Safety Act (317 points | 148 comments)
8. broccoli: A robust message queue system for Rust applications, designed as a Rust alternative to Celery (35 points | 11 comments)
9. IP-over-Toslink (4 points | 1 comment)
10. dnsclay: DNS UPDATE/AXFR/NOTIFY to many custom DNS operator APIs gateway (2 points | no comments)
11. WorstFit: Unveiling Hidden Transformers in Windows ANSI (5 points | no comments)
12. Some Programming Language Ideas (39 points | 23 comments)
13. Go is a Well-Designed Language, Actually (32 points | 88 comments)
14. Google & Linux Foundation Launch "Supporters of Chromium-Based Browsers" Fund (3 points | 1 comment)
15. A simple trick to understand Ruby’s lazy enumerator (8 points | no comments)
16. Shaping Ligatures in Monospace Fonts (1 points | no comments)
17. Process creation in io_uring (8 points | 1 comment)
18. Bringing SerenityOS to real hardware, one driver at a time (47 points | 3 comments)
19. SQLite Archive Files (35 points | 19 comments)
20. Soundness and Completeness: Defined With Precision [2019] (3 points | 1 comment)
21. Things To Do For the New oils.pub Domain (5 points | 5 comments)
22. Name Collision of the Year: Vector (9 points | no comments)
23. We spoke to Great Expectations about the library's DX (1 points | no comments)
24. Google launches a ‘neutral’ Chromium development fund (1 points | no comments)
25. Can LLMs write better code if you keep asking them to “write better code”? (1 points | no comments)
